section: This Services Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into on October 1, 2019 and is made effective as of November 1, 2019 (the "Effective Date")
explanation: The agreement states it is 'entered into' on October 1, 2019, but its 'Effective Date' is November 1, 2019. This creates an ambiguity regarding when the terms of the agreement become active. It's unclear whether actions or obligations during October 2019 are governed by this agreement, potentially leading to disputes over responsibilities and liabilities before the Effective Date.

section: Provider may not make any change in the Provider Representatives without the prior consent of the Recipient. Provider Representatives shall be dedicated to solely providing the Services to Recipient and shall not provide any such services or resources to Provider or any other customer of Provider.
explanation: This section is contradictory. It first states that Provider Representatives are dedicated to solely providing services to the Recipient, which implies they should not serve other clients. However, the section also includes 'Provider or any other customer of Provider,' causing ambiguity whether Provider Representatives can serve the Provider itself, separate from other customers. This wording implies that, while they can't serve Provider's *customers*, they might still be involved in Provider's internal operations unrelated to the Recipient.

section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: The phrasing 'This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement' is structurally flawed and does not make sense. It's unclear what the intended meaning of 'Effective Date, Agreement' is. This creates uncertainty regarding the start date of the agreement's obligations.
